occurrences.text: That was when she, Rebekah, had sought the Lord with regard to the struggle that was within her. And God says, there are two nations that are within thy womb in verse number 23. And we understand that Jacob becomes Israel, the nation of the people of God, the Israelites. And then Esau, he becomes Edom, or as we often see in the Word of God, the Edomites. And you find that throughout the scriptures, especially in the Old Testament in particular, you see that there's great conflict regularly that you read of between the children of Israel, the descendants of Jacob, and the Edomites, the descendants of Esau. And you see regularly these representations and these disagreements and these battles between these two groups of people. But we said that not only was it that there were two nations—remember, God continues and says, two men are people—shall be separated from thy bowels, and the one people shall be stronger than the other people, and the elder shall serve the younger. And we see that God is giving insight with regard to His plan. We looked at Romans 9 and discussed some of that in our last message. But we also noted that the application of this passage of scripture, or one application that we could look at, is not only the two nations, but there are two natures. And we dealt with this not only looking at Esau and
